result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court costs, fees and surcharges, DNA surcharge and restitution.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds/earnings.  Balance as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes: Be enrolled in school at least 20 hours per week.  If not enrolled in school, maintain employment of at least 30 hours per week.
No contact with James B. or Alexander S.

Cognitive Thinking Programming.
Absolute sobriety.
Pay restitution as ordered in case 15CF365.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample, pay DNA surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms; and that his voting rights are suspended and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey Dijohn Holmes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (25 pages) commencing OCTOBER 23, 2015 received and filed. kl
Per Judge Rothstein, the cash bail on deposit in this case is to be applied towards the restitution ordered in case 15CF365. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
PSI received and filed in case 15CF365. Parties notified. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Justice Point Report - Discharge Summary - received and filed in case 15CF365. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

As to COUNT 1-
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 dismissed but read in for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded.
Defendant sworn in.

As to COUNT 2-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum, and Jury Instructions received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing and pay a DNA surcharge.

State requested an adjournment of sentencing for victim notification. 

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.
Court ordered a presentence investigation WITH a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Court vacated the jury trial date of 10/12/15.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment and Pretrial Incarceration Credit form received and filed. 
Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Justice Point Report received and filed in case 15CF365. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Memorandum in Support of Motion for Consolidation of Charges received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  
Kimberly Schoepp for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the court for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense request for adjournment heard and denied by the Court.  The Court set this matter on the trial track.  State to file joinder motion within 10 days.  Parties to file motions within 2 weeks from today.  Any motions requiring testimony will be heard on the final pretrial date. Parties to file witness lists, jury instructions, and motions in limine by the final pretrial date (close of business day). State to file proposed verdict forms and substantive jury instructions by the final pretrial date.  The Court will not accept any negotiations after the final pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Justice Point report received and filed in case 15CF365. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement with attached restitution worksheet received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counesl requested a plea and sentencing date in August, due to his congested calendar.  Parties were advised that as of August 1, 2015, this calendar will be assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Branch 25, in Room G-55 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Court ordered all terms and conditions of bail are to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Deann L Heard appeared for Sara Nicole Volden Schroederthe State of Wisconsin.  Parties are working towards a resolution. Court ordered Defendant to continue cooperation with JusticePoint.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Defense counsel requested another Scheduling conference.   Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 20.  All terms and conditions of bail shall continue.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM022926  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/01/2015

Attorney Enku Edgar Lin in court, defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case added to Branch 20's calendar out of prelim yesterday (4/21/15); parties request another date.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Enku Edgar Lin.  Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in custody.  Ron Dague for Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JAMES B. OR ALEXANDER S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Casey Dijohn Holmes in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge MORONEY, Branch 20.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Cour advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
